intro: Sticherus bifidus, commonly known as the two-lobed sticherus, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Stichyidae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically oval or elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish or pale yellow in color. Sticherus bifidus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of wetland flora.
